    37	
    38	The ``pytest`` framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet
    39	scales to support complex functional testing for applications and libraries.
    40	
    41	An example of a simple test:
    42	
    43	.. code-block:: python
    44	
    45	    # content of test_sample.py
    46	    def inc(x):
    47	        return x + 1
    48	
    49	
    50	    def test_answer():
    51	        assert inc(3) == 5
    52	
    53	
    54	To execute it::
    55	
    56	    $ pytest
    57	    ============================= test session starts =============================
    58	    collected 1 items
    59	
    60	    test_sample.py F
    61	
    62	    ================================== FAILURES ===================================
    63	    _________________________________ test_answer _________________________________
    64	
    65	        def test_answer():
    66	    >       assert inc(3) == 5
    67	    E       assert 4 == 5
    68	    E        +  where 4 = inc(3)
    69	
    70	    test_sample.py:5: AssertionError
    71	    ========================== 1 failed in 0.04 seconds ===========================
    72	
    73	
    74	Due to ``pytest``'s detailed assertion introspection, only plain ``assert`` statements are used. See `getting-started <https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/getting-started.html#our-first-test-run>`_ for more examples.
    75	
    76	
    77	Features
    78	--------
    79	
    80	- Detailed info on failing `assert statements <https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/assert.html>`_ (no need to remember ``self.assert*`` names);
    81	
    82	- `Auto-discovery
    83	  <https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/goodpractices.html#python-test-discovery>`_
    84	  of test modules and functions;
    85	
    86	- `Modular fixtures <https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/fixture.html>`_ for
    87	  managing small or parametrized long-lived test resources;
    88	
    89	- Can run `unittest <https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/unittest.html>`_ (or trial),
    90	  `nose <https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/nose.html>`_ test suites out of the box;
    91	
    92	- Python 3.5+ and PyPy3;
    93	
    94	- Rich plugin architecture, with over 850+ `external plugins <http://plugincompat.herokuapp.com>`_ and thriving community;
    95	
    96	
    97	Documentation
    98	-------------
    99	
   100	For full documentation, including installation, tutorials and PDF documents, please see https://docs.pytest.org/en/stable/.
